title: Elastic collisions - kinetic energy of cart

content.description: A <math alttext="500 gram" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>500</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></math> cart moves to the right with a kinetic energy of <math alttext="0.14 joule" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>0</mn> <mtext>.</mtext> <mn>14</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mo> </mo> <mtext>J</mtext> </math> on a horizontal surface. The cart collides with a <math alttext="250 gram" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>250</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></math> block that is initially at rest. The cart and block collide elastically and the block moves to the right with a kinetic energy of <math alttext="0.12 joule" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></math>. Frictional forces are negligible.
content.question: What is the kinetic energy of the cart after the collision?

choices.label: <math alttext="0 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
